similaranime.anime: Haruka Naru Toki no Naka de: Hachiyoushou

recommendations.recommendation: I recommend it to the romance fans.. i rated seven but i can`t explain why i love this anime.....
Classic shoujo anime. A must see!
Nice anime! one of my favorite!
a never ending love story full of action =)
From the same creator of Ayashi no Ceres. This is a must see classic as well.

anime.description: Led by the illusion of a phoenix, two friends enter a restricted room at the library where a mysterious book titled, "The Universe Of Four Gods" falls at their feet. They pick up the book and begin to read it when they are suddenly transported into the book. The boundaries between fiction and reality become hazy as they meet new friends, enemies and loved ones.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: trap
tag.description: A trap is a plot device where a male character is mistaken for a female, with the intention of sexually deceiving other characters and/or the viewer. This behavior does not need to be intentional by the male (it is often not intentional) or continually maintained by the male, but the occurrence is common enough to deserve this fetish-specific tag. This is often achieved by portraying the male character as a female; primarily via their clothing and physical appearance, but also through his behaviour, and/or language. A male character misinterpreted by others as female, without action from the male (explicitly feminine dress or behaviour), is generally not considered a trap; instead they are likely just http://anidb.net/t2561 [androgynous]. The reverse case is known as a http://anidb.net/t1637 [reverse trap]. Note: the tag image is from http://anidb.net/a10475 [Himegoto].

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: cross-dressing
tag.description: This character sometimes wears clothes traditionally worn by and associated with the opposite sex. Cross-dressers often hide their cross-dressing identity for a long period of time and thus tend to become adept in accurately portraying the opposite sex in terms of voice, movement, behaviour, temperament, etc.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: alternative past
tag.description: An anime that takes place in an alternative past is an anime that clearly does not belong to the future or the present, and isn`t tied particularly closely to our history, or has ties to our history but only as a premise: there are too many things that don`t make sense for the time-period. In some cases there is futuristic technology present, but the overall setting still feels that of the past. However the setting must still take place on Earth, since we can not know if the history of a fantasy world is an alternate one or not.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: sex
tag.description: Sexual intercourse, the ultimate bond of love and the "Origin of the World" (just think of Gustave Courbet`s painting: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L%27Origine_du_monde). Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: first kiss
tag.description: The first kiss plays a role in this anime. Especially for the female cast this can be quite an important moment, so that stealing ones first kiss is serious for them.

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: love polygon
tag.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: reverse harem
tag.description: Reverse harem, or sometimes also male harem, is the common name for the gender-reversed version of the usual http://anidb.net/t2859 [harem genre]. In a reverse harem, instead of the usual situation with several female characters focused on one male character, the viewer sees several male characters surrounding a single female character. Aside from the swapping of the characters` genders, the trope`s details are mostly the same, with the majority of the changes relating to the differences in behavior between men and women of the characters` age range. The most notable exception is that, due to the most relevant characteristics of the trope`s fan base, reverse harem authors tend to go for http://anidb.net/t1760 [bishounen] looks. Though they are also exceptions to the common harem genre, harems with homosexual relationships are not covered by reverse harem.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: sexual abuse -- TO BE SPLIT AND DELETED
tag.description:
This tag is to be split into the following new tags under the http://anidb.net/t7220 [sexual abuse] category. Afterwards, delete this tag.
* http://anidb.net/t7222 [groping / molestation] * http://anidb.net/t1306 [chikan] * http://anidb.net/t7221 [psychological sexual abuse] * http://anidb.net/t2715 [rape / attempted rape]

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: important haircut
tag.description: When a character cuts off his or her hair, it often symbolizes a rite of passage or bout of character growth. A princess striking out on an adventure, or a new recruit at boot camp, for instance. Hair is something that takes time and effort to grow, so parting with it voluntarily can be a powerful act. This is particularly a big deal when women get haircuts. Yet in fiction, even an accidental hair slicing can leave a character with a surprisingly even cut. In many religions (Western Christianity, Ancient Egyptian religion, and others) priests and/or monks cut/shave their hair. Roman Catholic nuns also tend to cut and mantain their hair short under their veils when they enter the nunneries. The cutting of one`s own hair is also a part of Buddhist mythology, specifically something done by Siddhartha himself early on in his path to enlightenment, so anime examples might draw from this as an allusion. There are also some cultures, including Native American and many Asians, where a person would cut his or her hair as an act of grief, disgrace, or even rebellion. In the Confucian tradition, hair (like the rest of your body) is considered a gift from your parents and may not be damaged without a very good reason. Furthermore, prisoners and psychiatric patients commonly have their heads shaved, often to prevent the spread of lice, but sometimes also as a demeaning measure. Source: TVTRope

tag.name: emotions awaken superpowers
tag.description: During an extreme emotional state — rage, love, hate, angst, sadness, compassion — something inside the character will "click" that will increase greatly his/her power or a new superpower awakes, that surpasses anything achieved by him/her until then.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: fate
tag.description: Fate — The predestined path of all things. The outcome is inevitable and the consequences predetermined. Whether or not the protagonist ultimately decides to follow this path shall weigh heavily on their soul.

tag.name: damsel in distress
tag.description: The damsel in distress is usually a young, nubile woman placed in a dire predicament by a villain or a monster and requires a hero to dash to her rescue. Often used to unite the cast of a show for this one goal, to make them put differences aside and become a band of nakama. Examples: Sakoshita Yanagi from Rekka no Honoo, Yuuki Miaka from Fushigi Yuugi or Higurashi Kagome from Inuyasha.

tag.name: wardrobe limited to school uniform
tag.description: The main characters only wear school uniforms, even though other clothes would be more appropriate. Example: Kagome in Inu Yasha, wears her uniform in Inu Yasha`s world, although she is shown to own other clothes at home.

tag.name: surreal
tag.description: Refers to things or occurrences that are generally bizarre or dreamlike, with the relentless capability of replacing reality through the eyes of the beholder. Surrealism is boundless, limited only by thought itself.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: inter-dimensional schoolgirl
tag.description: One, or more, schoolgirls cross through time, space or some dimension using a space-warp-magic-portal-wormhole-singularity-thing to save one, or more, worlds, or planets. A major twist could be that the schoolgirl might originate from that very magic-futuristic world, bearing one great secret legendary power to defeat one big bad legendary foe. The return back home is the leitmotiv of the whole series.

tag.name: tone changes
tag.description: The anime switches quickly, often rather drastically between different moods or tones, sometimes even on the same scene.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: call my name
tag.description: "TETSUOOOOOO!!" "KANEDAAAAAA!!" "TAMAHOMEEEE!!" "MIAKAAAA!!" Feelings of any kind towards other characters are best shown by calling each other`s name, loud, REALLY LOUD. For better effect at least twice or thrice. For lover`s couples and mortal enemies it is a requirement to run towards each other while calling each other`s name, unaware of the surroundings.

tag.name: girly tears
tag.description: Usually girly tears are the ones not shed by men (duh). Like when a (stereotypical) girl watches something and cries her makeup out, a (stereotypical) dude just says, proclaiming his masculinity: "Meh, yet another soap opera bulls..t, I`ll be in my garage fixing my ride while playing heavy metal on a burning guitar ...with my teeth! And where`s my beer, woman?". So that`s how it goes: girly tears are for girls and sissies! Chuck Norris forbid a guy would weep watching something that has this tag! Now 20 push-ups! P.S. The opposite of "manly tears". Or is it? Let`s face it - it`s all subjective (and relative, and context-dependent).

tag.name: the power of love
tag.description: The power of love is not only the strongest power known to mankind, it is the strongest power in the universe. The power of love conquers all things. It makes people cry, it makes people laugh, it can make them sing and occasionally it even brings dead people back to life, just so. More so than the power of friendship, the power of true love gives boundless strength and resolution; by the power of love every hardship can be overcome, every issue can be resolved and it does make people resistant to food poisoning (caused by the bad cooking of their loved ones). Even the big bad evil doesn`t stand a chance against the power of true love and often ends up redeemed. Even when the power of love is not literally and directly responsible, the scene is often set so that the audience is left with the impression that it was "really responsible".

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: isekai
tag.description:
An isekai story is one in which the lead characters are transferred to and become stuck or trapped in another world, one completely different from the one they lived in up until the transfer. The new world is commonly a http://anidb.net/t2628 [fictional world], such as a http://anidb.net/t2838 [parallel world] or http://anidb.net/t2839 [virtual world] (other fictional world types can also apply). What defines the isekai genre is that the characters are sent to another world, often but not always a parallel one, and they generally cannot come back permanently without meeting a highly specific goal. In order to adapt to their new environment, they must use the abilities and knowledge brought from their former world as well as any that may have been bestowed upon them by their brave new world. In some cases, they will seek and eventually find a way to return; in others, they will gleefully embrace their new life. http://anidb.net/a144 [Inuyasha] is an example where isekai applies to a fictional world that is not also a parallel or virtual world. http://anidb.net/ch7246 [Higurashi Kagome] climbs down an ancient well at her grandfather`s shrine and is transported to feudal Japan (time travel). While she eventually gains the physical ability to travel back and forth between her time period and feudal Japan, her bonds and responsibilities to feudal Japan tie her there until they are ultimately resolved. For clarity, below is an illustrative example where isekai is applied to a non-fictional, non-parallel, non-virtual world.
* The main characters are from Earth. One day, they are abducted by Nazis from Mars (alternate "world") are brought back to their Martian base. The main characters are trapped on Mars. Their only escape is to defeat the Nazis and steal their spaceship to return to Earth (specific goal required to escape); they are left to thier own devices, with no prospect of help from Earth, and no way to contact Earth.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: sexual abuse
tag.description: Sexual abuse is the act of one person forcing sexual activities upon another. Sexual abuse includes not only physical coercion and sexual assault, especially rape, but also psychological abuse, such as verbal sexual behaviour or stalking, including emotional manipulation.

character.name: Tamahome
character.description: Real Name: Sou Kishuku Kanji: Ogre in episode 3, Hotohori reffers to him as the crab

character.name: Tasuki
character.description: Real Name: Kou Shun`u Kanji: Wings the leader of the mountain bandits, where he is known as Genrou

character.name: Mitsukake
character.description: Real Name: Myoujuan Kanji: Chariot He used to be the doctor of a village. He used his suzaku`s power to heal everyone, until his lover died

character.name: Nuriko
character.description: Real Name: Chou Ryuuen Kanji: Willow in episode 3, "she" introduces "herself" as Korin, a Royal Constor, later it`s discovered he was an Okama

character.name: Hotohori
character.description: Real Name: Saihitei Emperor of Konan Kanji: Star in episode 3 he refers himself as the sea serpent

character.name: Chiriko
character.description: Real Name: Ou Doukun Kanji: Extended Net He is a genius kid studying to become a Public Officer

episode.title: 華燭の典
Wedding Celebration
Fêtes de mariage
Свадебная церемония
Kashokunoten
episode.summary: Miaka is finally able to tell Yui about Nakago`s treachery, just in time for Nakago to appear in their own world. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひきさかれる愛
Shattered Love
Amour brisé
Растоптанная любовь
Hikisakareru Ai
episode.summary: Miaka escapes from prison following Yui`s ambush, and searches for Tamahome. Unfortunately, when she finds him, she`ll almost wish she hadn`t. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 朱雀の宿星[ほし]に殉じて
To Die for the Star of Suzaku
Mourir pour l`étoile de Suzaku
Умереть во имя звезды Судзаку
Suzaku no Hoshi ni Junjite
episode.summary: Nuriko fights off the bestial Ashitare, and at the same time, Tamahome confronts Yui. After, Nuriko consoles Tamahome on his doubt, while Nuriko affirms who he really is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鎮魂の空
Repose of the Soul`s Light
Le repos de l`âme
Покой сияющих сердец
Chinkon no Sora
episode.summary: The real world is no place for a character in a book, and Tamahome searches for the meaning of his existence. Meanwhile, in Konan, Mitsukake knows exactly what his purpose is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めぐり逢いの音
Magic Flute
La flûte enchantée
Волшебная флейта
Meguriai no Ne
episode.summary: After days of fruitless searching, an attempt on Miaka`s life reveals the seventh of the Suzaku Seven, the flute-playing Chiriko. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦いの閃光
The Flash of Battle
L`éclat de la bataille
Сполохи битвы
Tatakai no Senkou
episode.summary: A sudden attack on the ship leaves Miaka, Nuriko, and Tamahome trapped in a cave. When they rejoin the others, the Seiryu warrior Soi confronts them, but Miaka repels the attack. Finally landing in Hokkan, the group learns about the Shinzaho. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 分岐の光
Divergent Light
Faisceau divergent
Свет, что нас разлучит
Bunki no Hikari
episode.summary: Yui summons Seiryu and then makes her first wish. In the aftermath, everything changes, both in love, and in war. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蘇りの都
The City of Resurrection
La résurrection
Град воскрешённых
Yomigaeri no Miyako
episode.summary: It seems that Tasuki, the fifth Celestial Warrior, is dead. Miaka pursues a rumor about someone with the ability to resurrect the dead, but falls gravely ill. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決別の来同
Farewell Reunion
Réunion d`adieu
Прощальная встреча
Ketsubetsu no Raidou
episode.summary: Tatara of the Byakko Seven reveals not only the second Shinzaho, but the truth about what becomes of love between Warrior and Priestess. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見えざる敵
Enemies Unseen
Ennemis invisibles
Незримые враги
Miezaru Teki
episode.summary: Back in the world of the book, Miaka visits the home of Tamahome. However, Miaka soon learns that things have changed, as an assassin from another country targets her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛するがゆえ
For the Sake of Love
Au nom de l`amour
Во имя любви
Ai Suru ga Yue
episode.summary: Tamahome gives himself to the Kuto Empire in order to buy Miaka time to find the other Suzaku Seven. Miaka`s search doesn`t go smoothly, however. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 第一括 総集編~古昔之途[いにしえのみち]
Part 1 Digest: The Ancient Path
L`ancienne voie
Обзор первого сезона. Древний путь
Dai Ikkatsu: Soushuuhen - Inishie no Michi
episode.summary: As Miaka and the Suzaku Seven travel to Hokkan, the story pauses to reflect on the events that lead up to this point. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活の陽光
Sunlight of Rebirth
Le rayon de la renaissance
Свет возрождения
Fukkatsu no Youkou
episode.summary: After defeating Tomo, Miaka and the Suzaku Warriors recover in Sairo. But rather than relaxing, Tamahome begins to distance himself from Miaka, driving a new wedge between them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 帰りたい...
Going Home
Retour à la maison
Путь домой
Kaeritai...
episode.summary: Taiitsukun reveals herself to Miaka and the others, and reveals the way to return Miaka to her home. However, not everything goes as planned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青龍の巫女
Priestess of Seiryu
La prêtresse de Seiryu
Жрица Сэйрю
Seiryuu no Miko
episode.summary: Miaka is the Priestess of Suzaku, and it turns out that Yui is the Priestess of Seiryu. So much has changed, but the two are still friends... right? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 星見祭りの夜
Star Festival
La fête des étoiles
Звёздный фестиваль
Hoshimimatsuri no Yoru
episode.summary: Miaka and the Suzaku Seven prepare for their trip to Hokkan, the land of Genbu. Before they go, Tamahome visits home again, but finds only pain. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とまどう鼓動
Bewildered Heartbeat
Peine de cœur
Противоречивые чувства
Tomadou Kodou
episode.summary: In order to return her to her own world, the Celestial Warriors accompany Miaka to a mountain where Taiitsukun, a being said to control the universe, is said to reside. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 炎の決意
Resolution
Résolutions
Пламенное решение
Honoo no Ketsui
episode.summary: The Celestial Warriors and the Priestess begin the ceremony to summon Suzaku. But then, Nakago`s cunning plans to disrupt the ceremony are revealed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 朱雀の七星
The Seven Stars of Suzaku
Les Sept Étoiles de Suzaku
Семь звёзд Судзаку
Suzaku no Shichisei
episode.summary: Miaka must find the seven Celestial Warriors, and she already has two. The third soon reveals himself, but it`s not a joyous occasion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妖しき幻想
Bewitched Illusions
Illusions ensorcelées
Проклятое наваждение
Ayashiku Gensou
episode.summary: Reunited again, Miaka and Tamahome have but a moment to embrace before the illusionist Tomo of the Seiryu Warriors attacks. Miaka is trapped in a dream, but it`s far from a nightmare. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いとおしい人のために
For My Loved One
Pour ma bien-aimée
Ради любимого
Itooshii Hito no Tame ni
episode.summary: The Suzaku Seven reunite with the Priestess. The final battle begins against Nakago. Will this story have a happy ending? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二度と離れない
I`ll Never Leave You
Je ne te quitterai jamais
Я тебя никогда не покину
Nido to Hanarenai
episode.summary: Tamahome and Hotohori clash, fighting to the death. But the love between Tamahome and Miaka creates a miracle, making possible the impossible. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説の少女
The Girl of Legend
La fille de la légende
Девушка из легенды
Densetsu no Shoujo
episode.summary: Instead of finding textbooks to study with, Miaka Yuki finds an old book which turns out to be rather absorbing--literally. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻惑のぬくもり
Bewitched Warmth
Chaleur ensorcelée
Колдовской жар
Genwaku no Nukumori
episode.summary: Tamahome`s kindness is too much for Miaka to bear after her encounter with Nakago. She runs away from him and her life, and then encounters a familiar face. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 贖罪の瞬間
Atonement
Rédemption
Искупление
Shokuzai no Shunkan
episode.summary: Nakago stands before Tamahome and Miaka on Earth. Tamahome struggles valiantly, while Yui struggles with her own inner doubt. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とどかぬ願い
Unreachable Hope
Espoir déçu
Несбыточная мечта
Todokanu Negai
episode.summary: Tamahome is not the same Tamahome that Miaka knows and loves any more. With her heart torn apart, Miaka must say goodbye, and leave him with Yui and the Kuto Empire. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奈落の蜃気楼
Hell`s Mirage
Le mirage de l`enfer
Адский мираж
Naraku no Shinkirou
episode.summary: The Shinzaho is stolen from Miaka by someone once thought dead. Miaka`s guilt prompts her to take responsibility in a somewhat unusual manner. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 柳宿, 永遠[とわ]の別離[わかれ]
Nuriko, Eternal Farewell
Nuriko, regrets éternels
Прощай навеки, Нурико
Nuriko, Towa no Wakare
episode.summary: Nuriko opens the door to the Shinzaho, but not without a cost. A happy occasion is tainted by a grief too powerful to bear. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: この命賭けても
Even Wagering on This Life
Pari sur la vie
Пусть жизнь свою отдам я...
Kono Inochi Kakete mo
episode.summary: After being saved from Suboshi by Tamahome in the real world, Miaka is able to speak with Hotohori, one last time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋慕の罠
Love Trap
Piège d`amour
Капкан любви
Renbo no Wana
episode.summary: With the help of Chichiri`s powers, Miaka and Tamahome make a promise to meet so they may be reunited. Yui refuses to let Tamahome go. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不安の渦
Whirlpool of Doubt
Tourbillon de doute
Омут сомнений
Fuan no Uzu
episode.summary: Miaka and the Warriors search for the Shinzaho in the city of Touran, and Tamahome may have the answer. Meanwhile, Miaka struggles with whether she should return home, or keep her love. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 虚実の少年
Boy of Fact and Fiction
Être de réalité et de fiction
А был ли мальчик?
Kyojitsu no Shounen
episode.summary: Although Yui wanted to separate Miaka from Tamahome by returning to Earth, somehow Tamahome has come through as well. Meanwhile, the situation worsens back in Konan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 哀しき戦い
Battle of Sorrow
Gros chagrin
Скорбная битва
Kanashiki Tatakai
episode.summary: Miaka must die in order for the healer Shoka`s powers of revival to work. Hotohori makes one last plea to a reclusive doctor, where he learns the truth about Shoka. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 刹那の攻防
Moment of Battle
Le moment de la bataille
Сраженья миг
Setsuna no Koubou
episode.summary: Chiriko has been possessed by the evil Miboshi, and the Suzaku Seven must fight one of their own. Meanwhile, Yui prepares to summon Seiryu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 砦の狼
Wolf in the Fortress
Le loup
Волчья твердыня
Toride no Ookami
episode.summary: Miaka searches for the fifth of the Celestial Warriors among bandits, but ends up being taken hostage by a strange man with a wolf-like appearance. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 動きだした謎
Mysteries Afoot
Mystère en vue
Тайны зовут
Ugokidashita Nazo
episode.summary: Back on Earth, Miaka`s brother Keisuke researches the origins of the Universe of the Four Gods, and discovers something startling. He communicates with Miaka, who must make a choice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 越えられぬ壁
Unbreachable Wall
Mur impénétrable
Непреодолимая стена
Koerarenu Kabe
episode.summary: It seems the love Tamahome and Miaka have for one another is destined to end. However, while the two chase after one another, the Seiryu Warriors move to take the second Shinzaho. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逢いたい...
Brief Parting
Brève séparation
Краткий миг разлуки
Aitai...
episode.summary: Miaka returns home, only to find herself restless. She struggles with deciding where she belongs. And Yui seems to have disappeared... but where to? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あなたしかいない
Only You
Rien que pour toi
Только ты
Anata Shikainai
episode.summary: Though distraught over Yui`s pain and rage, Miaka commits herself once again to assembling the Suzaku Seven... and to Tamahome. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誓いの墓標
Tombstone Oath
La tombe et le serment
Надгробная клятва
Chikai no Bohyou
episode.summary: Suboshi, the twin of Amiboshi, wants revenge for the death of his brother. Horrified by the fate of Tamahome`s family, Miaka resolves to fight against Seiryu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偽りの恋
Deceptive Love
Amour trompeur
Фальшивая любовь
Itsuwari no Koi
episode.summary: Caught in Tomo`s fantasy world, Miaka is shown a world of love, kindness, and happy things. Will Miaka surrender to this pleasant dream, or will she remember what she truly loves? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 命果てても
Even If I Die...
Quitte à mourir...
Пусть я умру...
Inochi Hatete mo
episode.summary: Trapped in a mirror, Miaka faces herself in an all too literal way. When her shadow steps from the mirror to torment her friends, Miaka must make a difficult choice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 囚われの少女
Looking For Yui
À la recherche de Yui
В поисках Юи
Toraware no Shoujo
episode.summary: Troubled by advice from Chichiri, and in search of the missing Yui, Miaka travels to Kuto alone, leaving Tamahome with an aching heart. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛されて, 悲しくて...
Love and Sorrow
Amour et chagrin
Любовь и печаль
Aisarete, Kanashikute...
episode.summary: Taiitsukun shows up to reveal that not all is lost, and there still remains a method to summon Suzaku. However, what she tells to Miaka in private will change everything for her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: すれちがう想い
Missing Love
Amour manqué
Упущенная любовь
Surechigau Omoi
episode.summary: Miaka comes to understand Nuriko`s true feelings, and in assisting him, learns Hotohori`s true feelings as well. But Tamahome`s true feelings are still elusive. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謀略の予兆
Shadow of Intrigue
Sombre intrigue
Тень заговора
Bouryaku no Yochou
episode.summary: With Tamahome finally back to normal, all of the Konan Empire begin the preparations to summon Suzaku. However, they remain completely ignorant of Nakago`s trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 朱雀の巫女
The Priestess of Suzaku
La prêtresse de Suzaku
Жрица Судзаку
Suzaku no Miko
episode.summary: An encounter with the Emperor of Konan leads to Miaka discovering her purpose and her destiny in this new world. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心の夜明け
Dawn of the Heart
L`aube du cœur
Пробуждение сердца
Kokoro no Yoake
episode.summary: Carrying pain in their hearts, Miaka is tempted to forget everything, while Tamahome is tempted to abandon hope for himself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 託された希望
Entrusted Hope
Porteur d`espoir
Воплотившаяся надежда
Takusareta Kibou
episode.summary: With the seal broken, Miaka makes use of Yui`s sacrifice to summon the beast-god Suzaku, and uses its power against Nakago. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 君を護るために
To Protect You
Pour te protéger
Защитить тебя
Kimi o Mamoru Tame ni
episode.summary: Hotohori attempts to comfort Miaka as she struggles with her broken heart, desperate to forget about her love. But Tamahome won`t be forgotten so easily. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 踏みにじられた愛
Trampled Love
Amour piétiné
Растерзанные чувства
Fumi ni Jirareta Ai
episode.summary: Acting on a bad feeling, Tamahome races to find Miaka. He instead finds Nakago, who gloats about what he has taken from the Priestess of Suzaku. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 氷の防人
Guardians of Ice
Les gardiens de glace
Ледяные хранители
Koori no Sakimori
episode.summary: Within the cave of the Shinzaho, the Suzaku Warriors are confronted by a pair of two hundred year old ghosts of the Genbu Warriors. Miaka must prove herself worthy of the Shinzaho. Source: crunchyroll
